article.headline: Southern Cal 70, Tenn.-Martin 43
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Taj Gibson had 15 points and eight rebounds to lead host Southern California to a 70-43 nonconference victory over Tennessee-Martin on Friday night. Dwight Lewis scored 13 points and freshman DeMar DeRozan finished with 12 points for USC (4-2). Trojans guard Daniel Hackett added eight points, six rebounds and five assists. Lester Hudson finished with 20 points and was the only player for Tennessee-Martin (2-3) in double figures. It was the lowest output for the Skyhawks in a game this season. USC used a 28-4 run during the first half to pull away from Tennessee-Martin. The Skyhawks mustered two field goals during a 12-minute stretch and had just seven field goals during the first half, which they shot 26.9 percent from the field. USC shot over 57 percent from the field.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
